topic.title: The Future Of The Deep Web
topic.body:
What do you think will happen when advertisers start digging into the deep web?
Since much of the popular deep web is based on open source technology, then only thing that has kept advertisers out so far has been... well, just the fact they haven't thought to do it.
While the most popular deep web areas may not cooperate with advertisers, there really isn't anything stopping them from posting on places like this or paying listings sites from stapling misleading links on their sites.
Do you think (mainstream, commercial) advertisers will ever invade the deep web?

topic.title: Predators in Politics (not just MG)
topic.body:
"Weak people seek revenge.
Strong people seek forgiveness.
Intelligent people ignore."
- @JamesCappleman

So, immediately after leaving the priesthood after being outed as "gay", he married a lawyer and ran a racist campaign in Chicago for an alderman spot.
When pointed out that his policies and business dealings were hurting the poor in the area, he responded by changing his Twitter bio to say that intelligent people just ignore abuse.
There's been rumors he left the priesthood over child sex abuse allegations and that is how he met his lawyer husband.
I have no problem with gay people and identify as passive pansexual myself, but something about the way the guy phrased this message makes me think he is in fact a predator.
I also can't find any philosophers that claimed it was wise to ignore abuse/problems, nor calling revenge a concept solely for the weak.
It sounds like sophism that a predator would peddle to their victims.

His policies have gotten so bad people have picketed his house calling him a racist (just search "James Cappleman racism/protest" on youtube).

Is this just politics?

topic.title: Antivaxxers are mentally ill
topic.body:
Antivaxxers deny science, lie about what the mainstream scientific community say and what their conclusions are, and they use unsupported claims to peddle conspiracy theories.
Therefore... they're mentally ill. Psychotic, specifically.
Here are some facts:
- There are no robots in the vaccines.
- Vaccines have nothing to do with 5G.
- Vaccination doesn't cause autism.
- Vaccines do not cause allergic reactions in the overwhelming majority of the public.
- Vaccines are effective.
- Vaccines are not part of any "psy-op" to test conformity.
Grow up.

topic.title: Paranoid people are stupid, as are political extremists...
topic.body:
Just a reminder that you're all idiots.
Every few years morons like you keep claiming that the totalitarian government will drop down upon us.
Every few years you scream about Word War III.
Every few years it's another end of the World scenario.
Every few years you break down into tears and rage screaming that fictional material is a blueprint for reality.
Every few years you repeat conspiracies you read on 4chan or some other internet troll/skitzo platform.
Every few years you claim all Rights will be suspended.
Every few years you claim some magic leader will save us all.
Every few years you claim alien contact is around the corner.
It just goes on and on.
What in sam hill makes you losers so addicted to this borderline personality + skizto bullshit?
What kind of rush do you need satisfied so you don't relapse into cray-cray junkie dopamine land?
You know you're full of shit, otherwise you wouldn't post to rustle up your own jimmies.
And this is a substantiated fact because you all claim no one will listen or you only speak with your echo chambers.
Therefore the only possibility is that you do it rile yourselves up to feel something.
Get some prescription drug you losers.
Reality isn't boring enough to need to make up bullshit to "get off" or feel empowered ("in the know").
Watch videos of super storms. Read a book about the struggle to educated the public on science.
Anything besides posting political flame bullshit and nutty conspiracy bullshit.

topic.title: You claim to be extreme radicals yet also claim you're not the unhinged ones...
topic.body:
How quaint.
Half of you admit to being paranoid libertarians/anarchists and the other half admits to being fascist.
Yet, when a rational person asks to you consider the Scientific Method, Logic and Reason, you all freak out and start engaging in personal attacks and stating conclusions are incorrect even when they're supported with evidence.
You all claim the mainstream is part of some big conspiracy and keep claiming something will happen, but it never does.
There are so many flaws in your conspiratorial mindsets; least of all you reject the requirement of the burden of proof and in fact engage in shifting the burden of proof.
Good luck with that.

1606601124_17acbn9sNyYyLJrLfSz3KJxqonKZt.body:
> [dsfds56f4dfsd4f](#comment_3_13syutvzzp8g4tJP1c9m7vxDwRe7XUd82K): The holy grail for those advertisers is "traffic" non of those deep web open source tech has that...

I've seen ads on sites that barely get any traffic. There was a period in the early 2000s that ads and popup ads were on every single site... causing such a problem that browsers had to eventually in-bake ad blocking.
As it is now, most people install ad blockers on sites now, but advertisers may find a way to get around that with the deep web.
Protective layers could actually work against the idea of wedging out advertisers.

1608830774_1H9ZCecP2nbVicgXB77yqodz2xp4C.body:

Are you seriously so mentally ill that you sincerely believe if someone isn't number one that they die?
Honey, baby... America hasn't been number one since the 1980s.
Look it up.
Also, China isn't a "full-blown police state". Most of China is generally free, and the Chinese Government only clamps down on loud anti-Nationalists (which I agree is fascist).
But it's not some ultra-dystopia. Even anti-Chinese YouTubers show day-to-day life in China is pretty much unimpeded by the Government.
People work in normal shops, have families, etc.
Yes, China has it's issues, but so does every Country.
The dumb fear mongering about China is unfounded.
They have made zero effort to "take over the entire world".
They're equally allowed to expand business and fight for their rights just like you, me and everyone.

1614725482_1FS7cWbFfDHBxfTJSWmko38NU2iSq.body:
That's how Keynesian Economics work.
Contrary to what internet conservatives and libertarians will have you believe, the Austrian school of Economics ALSO supports equating spending to positive economic outcomes.
Hoarding isn't Austrian economics, and an economy has to move to be working.
Everyone shutting themselves up in their houses doesn't produce wealth.
Wealth is a concept, as is value. Contrary to what many people have been lead to believe, most "valuable" materials aren't really that more precious than other common materials.
Yes, this applies to gold and diamonds as well.
No, your coin collection isn't going to make the history books, and you can't trade any of that if the economy crashes due to hoarding and a lack of spending.
Think of the economy as a living thing. To be alive, it has to move.
You're not promoting hibernation or nut-squirreling, you're promoting hoarding and suicide.
Stop being stupid please.

> [bortbortbort](#comment_10_16e6K52Q1xLbhxAFrLeXvDjS5q8QhQ4eQm): government spending based on borrowed funds isn't good and it's inflating the bubble.

It's a myth that the current base of the currency is based on borrowed/owed articles.
That's only flung around in the Sovereign Citizens Movement circles of utter bullshit.

No, money isn't borrowed from the Treasury, Mint or Federal Reserve.
No, the Federal Reserve is not a "private company" that makes loans out to the Mint.
It's part of the Federal Treasury Department.

The value of the US Dollar is based on a number of things:
1. GDP value
2. Import/Outport Value
3. Precious Reserves (Minerals, Metals)
4. Natural Resource Reserves (Gas, Oil)
5. US Based Stock
6. US Bonds

Foreign investors hold roughly 40% of the US' debt, which is outmatched by how much debt is owed to the USA by the same Countries.
No, they don't cancel each other out instantly to get a more accurate "live" balance; that's not how live economics work.
A example would be that the US owes China 1.1 Trillion, but China owes the US 2.1 Trillion.
This isn't paid back and forth with Tax money, it's virtual credit backed by Valuable Resource Reserves which can only be pulled at the end of the economic cycle.
No Country has done this because then they would have to start all over and pay to get back into the trade cycle (current estimated cost of this is about 4 Trillion, with 10 Trillion required for Rebound Reserves).

They're not banned. The only books actually banned are books that contain illegal things like perverted crap.
This "they're banning books!" is mixing up Cancel Culture with Banning.
Cancel Culture is when people decide as a group not to support something.
That's just people exercising their rights.
Some may even protest to companies, which is also their right.
But it's not law.
Anyway, it's Conservatives that have a history of banning books.
Liberals just point to harmful media. How is that "hiding" anything if they're pointing to it as an example of destructive media?

2. How is ethical analysis and action a "front"?
3. Why is direct exposure a requirement for anything?
4. The Germans didn't leave up Nazi bullshit to be reminded of why they were wrong, correct or incorrect?
5. Canceling isn't the same as legalizing; It's just means not supported. Nothing has been criminalized.
6. Again, showing ethics and civil standards are not the same thing as thought control.
7. Do you know what a Slippery Slope Fallacy is?
8. The Children comment is a complete non-sequitur. Do you know what that is?

Argumentum ad absurdem fallacy detected.
Asking you for a citation doesn't at all indicate a claim of faith on the other end.
I'm an atheist and an evidentialist. All claims require evidence. Fauci isn't the only scientist on this case; the World Health Organization and millions of healthcare professionals are involved as well.
Occam's Razor indicates the simplest explanation is the most rational one.
In this case, an pandemic is far more rational than a vast conspiracy theory.
Take your straw man and absrudem arguments elsewhere, you mentally ill, tinfoil-hat wearing lunatic.

> [anonymouslogin](#comment_297_17AMQVbBa12XB3xFWKDnP2dCEx92TaiY7X): First of all, Fuck you. Second, there is no reason anyone should be homeless in a first world country, much less the lower echelon of the working class. There has been a shift from substance abusing people, and people suffering untreated illness to families living in tents. You have some nerve calling me, a person simply sharing observations a coward. Polls, petitions, protesting...the same shit that brought us all to our knees, begging some rich fuck for a job that takes 80 hours a week and still doesn't pay the bills? Pocketbook? Sure, gold definitely changes policy, but the people in power keep all of it for themselves. Inflation at 12%? Here is a raise that doesn't even account for the stated inflation rate of 2%. I want people to get angry. They should be angry about this, and when it hits...we're coming for you oligarchs. I'm going to burn you alive in your fucking mansion.

"Fuck you" - Great rational argument there.

"Second, there is no reason anyone should be homeless in a first world country" - Except the people that are criminals, don't choose to care for themselves, don't choose to treat others humanely, and those and don't want housing.

"much less the lower echelon of the working class" - I've read the book The Working Poor, and less than 1% of the homeless even attempt to work. 98% of are not only mentally ill, they're also complete psychopaths. Look it up, buttercup.

"There has been a shift from substance abusing people, and people suffering untreated illness to families living in tents." - Even if that were true (and it's not according to the World Health Organization statistics) you don't just get to demand free property and land when people working for it can't even obtain it. Why do the lazy, insane people get free everything and those that work don't?

"Polls, petitions, protesting...the same shit that brought us all to our knees, begging some rich fuck for a job that takes 80 hours a week and still doesn't pay the bills?"  - Then start your own business, unless you're lazy, crazy, or stupid.
"Pocketbook? Sure, gold definitely changes policy, but the people in power keep all of it for themselves." - Prove it, lazy conspiracy nut.

"Inflation at 12%? Here is a raise that doesn't even account for the stated inflation rate of 2%. I want people to get angry." - Hey, idiot... no business can pay you more than they take in. They have to cover head, taxes and pay everyone and have savings for the business and improvements. At the very best all employees should be earning at least 25% of what they help bring into the company because the rest is to keep the business going. Guess what?  Even if you took 100% of all CEO/management income and distributed it across their workers, they wouldn't see much of a boost. Why? Because that's how percentages work with division.

"it's unpleasant but nothing a short shit on your gold toilet, and a good brushing won't fix, meanwhile the faceless corporate beast consumes your fellow man, and shits out soylent green money for all of your elite friends." - I don't have any elite friends, jackass, I just understand BASIC MATH.

This has been explained by economists time and time against, but most Americans have a 8th grade level of math comprehension.

If all of the Walmart Management divided all of their income across their employees, they'd all receive less than dollar. Because they employ millions of people. So, in example, a million divided by a million... is one. One dollar. But Walmart employs MILLIONS, not just one million.

Same thing with homelessness. Even if all the billionaires in the USA, were taxed at 100%, their wouldn't be enough to feed, cloth, home and educate the homeless. The figures on people like Musk (who isn't American) and Bezos on YouTube videos are fake because they're only calculating for one month or one year. Then what?

If you want to cry about it, then talk about how housing prices should come down; that the housing market should be regulated like power and water. That Apartment Housing should never exceed Social Security Income. Something RATIONAL like that instead of your emotional crying and anger nonsense.
